page.title: 16 ARCHAEOLOGICAL DIG-WEST ROW
page.content: THE WEST ROW AREA IS RICH IN CERTAIN ARCHAEOLOGICAL MATERAL AND KEEN-EYED LOCALS HAVE ALWAYS BEEN VERY VIGILANT ESPECIALLY AT TIMES OF HIGH WINDS, RAIN AND PLOUGHING. MANY OF THEIR FINDS ARE DISPLAYED IN THE MUSEUM AT MILDENHALL. A FIELD OFF HIGHLAND DROVE, JUST BEYOND THE SPEEDWAY STADIUM, IS THE SITE OF A DIG BEGUN AFTER DISCOVERIES BY A LOCAL ARCHAEOLOGIST. THIS IS A BRONZE AGE SETTLEMENT SITE AND EXCAVATIONS, STARTED IN 1981, ARE CONTINUING TODAY,WITH THE INTEREST AND CO-OPERATION OF THE LANDOWNER. THE POST-HOLES OF A SMALL, ROUND HOUSE WITH A PORCH,HAVE BEEN LOCATED, AND OTHER FINDS INCLUDE:PIECES OF POTTERY,ARROW-HEADS,KNIVES,FLINT -SCRAPERS,BORERS,JET TOGGLES,BEADS AND SOME STONE ITEMS.
